page.title: 04Dallacre Farm Estate 1
page.content: In March 1983 Mr Ted Windsor, a small holder converted his pig sties into 7 small industrial units. 5 rural industries operate from them. Floor Pride Textiles started in September 1983 and used three units. A. Thompson started Car Restorations in December 1984. J.D.R. Fabrications came in February 1985, followed by Gun Safe in March 1985. There is also a barn where a thatcher Mr.M.Davies, stores his raw materials of reed and sedge. Floor Pride Textiles makes sweat shirts. They design the garments and make the patterns. They cut the materials with an electric knife. The garments are overlooked by out-workers who live within a 35 mile radius of the factory. At the factory designs are screen-printed on to the garments. Three ladies and four men work there. They make 3,600 garments weekly.
